description:
# Your Final Quest!

You've learned everything you need. Now prove your mastery by building a complete RPG management system from scratch in C#!

## The Ultimate Challenge

Create a **Complete RPG Character & Quest Management System** that combines everything you've learned.

### System Requirements:

#### 1. Character Management
- Create characters with: name, class, level, health, mana, strength, intelligence
- Level up characters (increase stats)
- Display character information
- Save/load characters using JSON

#### 2. Inventory System
- Add items (weapon/armor/potion/misc)
- Remove items by name
- Display inventory sorted by value
- Calculate total inventory value using LINQ

#### 3. Quest System
- Load quests from data
- Mark quests as completed
- Track quest rewards
- Calculate completion rate

#### 4. Battle System
- Fight enemies with turn-based combat
- Calculate damage based on character stats
- Award XP and gold for victories
- Level up when enough XP earned

#### 5. Main Menu
- Display menu with options
- Handle user input
- Navigate between features
- Save and exit

### Example Features:

```
=== RPG MANAGEMENT SYSTEM ===
1. View Character
2. Manage Inventory
3. View Quests
4. Battle
5. Save & Exit

Enter choice: _
```

### Technical Requirements:

‚úÖ **Must Use:**
- Variables, strings, numbers
- Input/output (Console.ReadLine)
- If/elif/else
- For and while loops
- Lists and Dictionaries
- Classes and objects
- Methods with parameters and returns
- LINQ for data operations
- JSON for save/load
- Proper code organization

‚úÖ **Success Criteria:**
- All 5 systems work correctly
- Clean, readable code
- Proper error handling
- Engaging user experience
- 200+ lines of code

## Your Quest Begins...

This is YOUR project. Plan it, design it, build it. You have all the knowledge you need. Good luck, adventurer!
hints: This is a BIG project! Break it down into small steps. Start with one system at a time.
Phase 1: Get character creation working. Test it thoroughly before moving on.
Phase 2: Build the inventory system. Add a few items and make sure display works.
Phase 3: Implement the quest system. Start simple - just displaying quests.
Phase 4: Create the battle system. This is complex - test with simple enemies first.
Phase 5: Build the main menu. Connect everything together with a switch statement.
Remember: It's okay to start simple and add features later. A working simple system is better than a broken complex one!
Test frequently! Run your code after adding each method to catch errors early.
Don't aim for perfection - aim for completion. You can always improve it later!
